==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=东}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
Phonetic borrowing – originally represented a bag tied at both ends (like a cellophane-wrapped candy with the ends twisted), and was later borrowed phonetically to mean “east”. This borrowing may have been influenced by reinterpreting the character as the sun ({{zh-l|*日}}) rising behind a tree ({{zh-l|*木}}), which is the traditional (though incorrect) etymology, as given in ''{{w|Shuowen}}''.

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|東方|とうほう}}: eastern direction
* {{ja-r|東南|とうなん}}: southeast
* {{ja-r|東亜|^とうあ}}: East Asia
* {{ja-r|東洋|とうよう}}: Orient
* {{ja-r|東部|とうぶ}}: eastern part
* {{ja-r|東西南北|とうざいなんぼく}}: east, west, south, and north
* {{ja-r|関東|^かんとう}}: Kanto
* {{ja-r|東風|とうふう}}: a spring wind that blows from the east
* {{ja-r|中東|^ちゅうとう}}: Middle East
* {{ja-r|東京|^とうきょう}}: Tokyo
* {{ja-r|東上|とうじょう}}: going to Tokyo
* {{ja-r|東名高速道路|とうめい こうそく どうろ}}: Tokyo-Nagoya Expressway
* {{ja-r|東側|ひがしがわ}}: east side
* {{ja-r|東口|ひがしぐち}}: east entrance
* {{ja-r|東半球|ひがし はんきゅう}}: Eastern Hemisphere
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|とう}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とう}} {{m|zh|東|tr=tuwng||east}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|とう}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|とう}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=とう}}
# {{abbreviation of|lang=ja|sort=とう|nodot=1|関東|tr=Kantō}}: the Kantō region
# {{abbreviation of|lang=ja|sort=とう|nodot=1|東国|tr=Tōgoku}}: eastern Japan

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひむかし}}
{{IPAchar|*/pimukasi/}} → {{IPAchar|/fimukaɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/himukaɕi/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ひむかし}}.  Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひむかし|日|tr1=hi|t1=sun|向か|tr2=muka|t2=facing, direction|風|tr3=shi|t3=wind, direction}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひむかし}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひむかし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ひむかし|obsolete}} [[east]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひんがし}}
{{IPAchar|/pimukasi/}} → {{IPAchar|/pimugasi/}} → {{IPAchar|/fimugaɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/fingaɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hingaɕi/}}

Sound shift from earlier ''pimukasi''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひんがし}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひんがし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ひむかし|obsolete}} [[east]]
#* 10th century: [[w:Ise Monogatari|Ise Monogatari]] (chapter 4, page 82)
#*: むかし、'''東（ひんがし）'''の五条に大后の宮おはしましける、西の対に住む人有けり。

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひがし}}
{{IPAchar|/hingaɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/higaɕi/}}

Sound shift from earlier ''hingashi''.  Now the standard word for {{m|en|east}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひがし|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK|acc2=3|acc2_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひがし}}

# [[east]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|ひがし|proper}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=ひがし}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あずま}}
{{IPAchar|/aduma/}} → {{IPAchar|/ad͡zuma/}} → {{IPAchar|/azuma/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=あずま}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>  Ultimate derivation unknown.  A speculative origin might be a compound of {{m|ja|天|tr=ama||sky, heavens}} + {{m|ja|端|tr=tsuma||edge, beginning}}, but the [[elision]] of the ''ma'' in ''ama'' does not follow normal patterns.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あずま|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あずま|hhira=あづま}}

# [[east]], Eastern Japan

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|あずま|proper}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=あずま}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=あずま}}
